title: Drawing, 1770–86
medium: Pen and black and gray ink over traces of black chalk on off white laid paper, laid down
markings:
Cooper Union Museum (Museum of the Arts of Decoration, noir) 
[Lugt 457d
Cooper Union Museum [Lugt 457e]
dimensions:
Sheet: 8 7/16 x 11 3/8 ins. (214 x 286 mm)
Mount: 8 5/8 x 11 1/2 inches (218 x 292 mm)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: A small village is lightly drawn in the middle distance, flanked by trees rising from left and right foreground. A small figure is sketched in the foreground walking along a road.  Mountains are visible in the distance.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1770–86.
1770–86. Pen and black and gray ink over traces of black chalk on off white laid paper, laid down. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-333.
